snippet: About two dozen City Council members planned to introduce a bill to create an office to monitor the police and “conduct independent reviews of the department’s policies, practices, programs and operations.”
abstract: About two dozen City Council members plan to introduce a bill to create an office of the inspector general to monitor practices of the New York City Police Department; bill is part of package of legislation being pushed by a new coalition called Communities United for Police Reform that would, among other goals, address racial profiling and require that people who are stopped and frisked by the police be given an explanation for the stop.
lead_paragraph: About two dozen City Council members planned to introduce a bill to create an office to monitor the police and “conduct independent reviews of the department’s policies, practices, programs and operations.”

headline.seo: City Council to Weigh Inspector General for the Police Dept.
